all,

[[This is not meant to be a flame-bait]]

But jprobe & jtest, are not anywhere near Mercury-loadrunner is, 
<<another great product from jerusalem>>, when you are testing web-
applications or client/server apps, the amount of things do-able and 
the variables that you can introduce are nowhere near loadrunner by 
these and other competing products. 

To have repeatable , automated tests that not only tell u about your 
IF-THEN-ELSE code but also about your overall application 
performance,  [[remember the familial  sum of parts != whole]]
in case of performance metrics. 

In many cases we have found that things like server-warmup, heapsize 
tuning are things which your normal jprobe & jtest are never going to 
come up with. Nor can you generate things like network-delay & 
simulataneous hits in a fashion loadrunner does.

So guys there who are doing serious web-testing (blackbox) , try 
loadrunner, its pricey but worth the moolah! & efforts.

<<what am i doing talking off loadrunner on a junit - mailing list>>
Well i thought there were many people asking here about blackbox 
testing and decided to draw their attention to this nice tool.

No offense meant to rest of the juniteers.

regards
krishna




--- In junit@y..., Jalam Singh Bhati <jalams@y...> wrote:
> Hi,
>   You can test Java (or J2EE) application using Jtest
